title: Cloud Architecting and Security | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This specialised micro-credential imparts cloud computing skills, covering architecture, big data analytics, and security.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This specialised micro-credential imparts cloud computing skills, covering architecture, big data analytics, and security.
Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity, Computer Architecture, Competency-based Education

Cloud computing plays a vital part in modern IT infrastructure, a paradigm shift that empowers business transformation and innovation. This specialised micro-credential covers essential knowledge in cloud computing as well as how to architect cloud solutions, handle large-scale data in the cloud, and implement security measures.
As a learner, you will first be equipped with fundamental knowledge and practical skills on cloud computing, including cloud service models, deployment methods and cloud application development.

You will then dive into the arena of cloud computing architecture and big data analytics tools and methods, where you will gain skills in cloud data storage, database, networking, auto scaling and load balancing, microservices, serverless architectures and more.

Lastly, you will gain proficiency in cloud security, encompassing key aspects such as cybersecurity technologies, roles and responsibilities, techniques for securing data (at rest and in transit), as well as industry best practices. You will then apply your newfound knowledge by designing and developing secure cloud services.

Integrating online and in-person delivery, the micro-credential offers various learning activities such as online or in-person lab sessions using Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud resources, quizzes for assessment and knowledge check, and hands-on projects on public cloud infrastructure. By the end of the course you will gain the competencies to design and construct cloud solutions with scalability, flexibility, robustness and security.
This micro-credential is part of the
The micro-credential prepares learners for the following job roles:
Digital, cyber and IT security architects, assessors, analysts, and engineers
System, solution, infrastructure, and enterprise architects
Technical leaders, program and project managers, middle management, and executives

There is no specific assumed knowledge for this micro-credential. However, having at least one year of experience in computer architecture, operating systems and a general understanding of computing applications, web services, and interfaces is preferable.

This micro-credential is predominantly delivered through a competency-based education (CBE) approach where learners acquire and demonstrate mastery of knowledge and skills that are directly relevant to job functions. This prepares them to be industry-ready where they can apply their newly acquired competencies to their work.
The above are competency units that constitute this micro-credential. Upon completion of the micro-credential, you will be able to:
Construct applications by developing and deploying containerised solutions, virtual machines, serverless functions, and utilising various virtualisation technologies
Develop cloud-based web applications using cloud instances and database services on public cloud infrastructure
Design and develop elastic web services that can adapt to dynamic workload with auto load balancing and dynamic scaling
Configure and deploy Hadoop/Spark and artificial intelligence (AI) for data analytics in the cloud
Protect cloud applications by securing network environments and data access (both at rest and in transit) in the cloud

During the course, you will have access to a team of qualified success coaches who can work with you on learning strategies or to develop a personalised learning plan. Through the success coaches, you can gain access to a wide range of resources and support services, and be empowered with the necessary tools to navigate your learning journey successfully.
Associate Professor/Programme Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor/Programme Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Weihan Goh is an Assistant Professor at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), where he teaches primarily in the Information Security degree programme. His teaching and research interests include security testing, digital forensics, blockchains, and applied cryptography, as well as technologies for cybersecurity education, such as cyber ranges, CTF / CDX, and anti-fraud / anti-cheat systems. He leads the GoSecure vulnerability assessment programme funded by the Infocomm Media Development Authority of Singapore (IMDA), and up until recently, held a CREST Registered Penetration Tester (CRT PEN) qualification. Beyond research, he also participates in capture-the-flag exercises, and have mentored student teams participating in cybersecurity hackathons to successes both locally and internationally. Dr Goh received his PhD and BEng, both in Computer Engineering, from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, in 2013 and 2008 respectively. He goes by the CTF handler 'icebear', and frequently plays as part of the team Polar Bear Hacking Group.
Assistant Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Li Xiaorong is an Assistant Professor in the Infocomm Technology Cluster at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). Dr Li works on the frontiers of distributed computing systems and large-scale artificial intelligence. She has taught courses such as mobile and cloud computing, database systems, etc.

Before that, she was a senior research scientist and capability group manager, focusing on cloud/edge computing for big data analysis, AI/Machine Learning, modelling and simulation in A*STAR Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC). Dr Li was also an Executive Manager and a technologist working on various topics such as green data centres, AI and technology roadmap at Infocomm Media Development Authority, Singapore. She received her PhD in Electrical and Computing Engineering from the National University of Singapore in 2006 and her B.E. from the Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications in 1998.

Her interests include parallel and distributed/high-performance computing, big data analysis, AI/ML, modelling and simulation, green computing, etc. Dr Li is a senior member of IEEE and she has published more than 50 papers in prestigious international journals and conferences.
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

A/Prof Alvin Chan was the Director of Programmes (Sep 2020- Sep 2022) of the Infocomm Technology Cluster at SIT. He was awarded the Highest Overseas Consultancy Award by Hong Kong Polytechnic University, and the IBM Prize for Computer Engineering by IBM UK and the University of Leeds.

A/Prof Chan’s research interests include middleware technologies for context-aware computing, the Internet of Things, mobile and cloud computing, and immersive media. A key characteristic of his research focuses on translating empirical methodologies to find applied solutions for existing problems. This led to his project team being awarded the Gold Medal at the 43rd and 45th Geneva Invention Exhibition in Switzerland.

He has published three co-edited books and more than 120 papers in major international journals and conference proceedings. Dr Chan was named among the Top 2% of scientists in the world,  according to a list released by Stanford University in 2021.
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Huaqun Guo is an Associate Professor in the Infocomm Technology cluster at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). Dr Guo has taught information security courses such as security analytics, web security, ethical hacking, and data structures and algorithms.
Before joining SIT, Dr Guo was Cybersecurity Technical Senior Manager at an MNC, Senior Scientist at the Institute for Infocomm Research (I
R), Agency for Science Technology and Research (A*STAR), Senior Research Staff at NUS and Senior Engineer at Kent Ridge Digital Labs (KRDL).

Dr Guo received her B.Eng and M.Eng from Tianjin University, and her M.Eng and PhD from the National University of Singapore (NUS) respectively. She has published about 100 referred papers in international conferences, journals, and books. Her research areas include network security, OT security, AI for cyber security, blockchain, ISO/IEC 27001 and security risk analysis, applied cryptography, vehicular networks and security, and communications.
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Wendy Hui is an Associate Professor at the Singapore Institute of Technology. She earned a B.E. (Hons) in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from the University of Canterbury, New Zealand, an MSc in Actuarial and Financial Sciences from Curtin University, Australia, and a PhD in Information Systems from Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.

Her research interests include economics of information security and behavioural research in information security. Her works have appeared in top journals in information systems. Dr Hui has many years of teaching experience in different parts of the world, including UAE, China, and Australia.

She has taught information security courses such as Introduction to information security, ethics in information security, and information security management. Her teaching approach, characterised by a supportive style, has received much appreciation from her students.
Lead Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Lead Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Arthur Loo serves as the Team Lead for Electronics and Information Communications Technology (EICT) in the Professional Officers Division at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT).

His professional interests include Embedded Systems, Cloud Technology, Artificial Intelligence, and Cybersecurity. Arthur has a Master of Technology (MTech) in Knowledge Engineering from the National University of Singapore (NUS) and a Bachelor of Engineering (BEng) in Mechanical Engineering from Nanyang Technological University (NTU).

Being an active lifelong learner of continuous learning, he actively participates in specialist diploma courses and maintains ongoing involvement with industry and professional communities to enhance his skills.
(optional, but it's encouraged to attend some sessions and to book in advance)
A Specialist Certificate in Cloud Architecting and Security will be issued to learners who:
Attend at least 75% of the course and
Undertake and pass all credit bearing assessments
The learner will undertake a combination of in-class assessments, and hands-on project assignments on a public cloud infrastructure.
The full fee for this course is S$9,868.86.
will be collected before course commencement.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Should you decide to convert to the degree pathway, you will be subject to SIT’s tuition fees and may qualify for the Ministry of Education (MOE) tuition grant, based on eligibility criteria set by MOE. Please note that the SkillsFuture subsidy will no longer be applicable once you convert to the degree pathway.

There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

Earn micro-credentials in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway) and unlock career opportunities in areas such as DevOps, network security and machine learning. Stack these micro-credentials towards a Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing at SIT.
What coding skills do I need for this micro-credential?

Basic experience in Linux/Windows command line, PHP, and knowledge about computer architecture, operating systems, databases, and concepts of computing applications, web services, and interfaces is preferable.

Improving Patient Outcomes through Advanced Clinical Supervision Competency

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) taps on evidence-based education practices to address the increasing demand for advanced clinical supervision competencies among Allied Health Professionals and improve patient outcomes.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Competency-based Education
Upskilling is Not an Uphill Task

Questions like “Am I too old?”, “Will I be able to keep up?” and “Can I afford it?” are often on the minds of adult learners when considering upskilling and upgrading. Robin Ngan, Director of the SITLEARN, tackles these questions and shares tips for how to make the most of one’s lifelong learning journey.
Competency-based Education, Career Growth and Transition
What’s needed for stackable microcredentials toward a degree?
Forest Tan describes how to begin creating a flexible pathway where learners can accumulate microcredentials aligned to industry that can stack toward a degree.
How to coach in-employment lifelong learners for success
A team from Singapore Institute of Technology offers insights from working with in-employment learners who are seeking to upskill by studying for degrees.
The future of learning: How competency-based education is shaping skills development

As the shelf-life of skills shortens, it's time to rethink the traditional approach to upskilling. With competency-based education, employees are able to master the skills that directly impact their careers, and employers are able to assess competency accurately.
